headline: Cranberry Sauce with Apples
description: Pectin from Granny Smith apples helps this cranberry sauce set and brings another layer of flavor to a classic recipe.
name: Cranberry Sauce with Apples
recipeIngredient: 1 (12 ounce) package fresh cranberries, rinsed and sorted
2 large Granny Smith apples - peeled, cored, and diced

recipeInstructions.text: Place cranberries, apples, water, sugar, and cinnamon in a medium saucepan over medium heat; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until cranberries pop and apples are soft, about 20 minutes.
Remove from the heat and cool completely. Serve, or cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

review.reviewBody: This is become a hit for Thanksgiving. My family used to only eat the stuff from a can until I made this 2 years ago! Now they request it every holiday.
It was some of the best cranberry sauce I've ever had, it tastes even better if you add a dash of orange juice while it's cooking!
Love it. Great recipe. Very easy and tasty. Making it again for Christmas. This time used 1/2 Splenda 1/2 brown sugar.

I made this tonight. So amazing! I added 1/2 more sugar, and cinnamon to it. if your going to make it and serve it, I recommend making it a day ahead, so it can set up. The flavor was amazing! Highly recommend!! Would give it a 10 star if I could :)
I used Gala apples instead of Granny Smith so it wouldnâ€™t be so tart. Very yummy!!
I found this recipe a few years ago and I've made it every year since. I just love it and I just will eat it by itself!
I made no changes and everyone absolutely loved it.

The combination of cranberries and Granny Smith apples is pretty great. Personally, I can't stand cinnamon so I left it out. The base of crans and apples makes this recipe very adaptable. The only other thing I did was add just a pinch of salt to make the flavor shine just a bit more. Excellent combination!

It was a quick recipe to make and I liked it so much better than the can stuff that no one really eats. So I thought I would try this recipe and I am eager to serve it at the table this year. It taste more like a Preserve or Jam.

This is delicious ! My 9 yr old grandson loves canned cranberry jelly. I worried the cranberries would be too strong for his taste but it was a hit with the little guy. My hubby liked it too. The apple retained it's own flavor which was a sweet balance to the tart cranberry. (I used Gala apples) This is an easy recipe and a definite keeper.
I did not make any changes, and I will definitely make again. I ate it by itself as a dessert.
I added grated orange peel and chopped up orange........delicious! Just like Mother used to make
I love everything cranberry, but not everyone shares cranberries tartness. The apples adds a touch of sweetness and balance to the cranberries. Thanks for a little twist on my old favorite!
The cinnamon is a fantastic addition!
I thought the addition of apples and cinnamon was a Great addition . Will make again.
